vision.notes: Likely functional in adults given habitat, but possibly reduced in some deep-sea species. Requires further research to determine the extent of adaptation to deep-sea light conditions.

mechanoreception.notes: Lateral line system likely present and important for detecting water movement and prey. Given the deep-sea habitat, mechanoreception would be valuable for spatial awareness and prey detection.

chemoreception.notes: Olfaction and taste are likely important for locating food items on the sea floor (sea anemones, echinoderms, molluscs, and worms).

electroreception.notes: Electroreception has not been mentioned in the provided text. However, it is plausible for a deep-sea fish species.
